title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Western, Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kurunegala and Mannar districts after 2.00 p.m.

title: South Korea’s Constitutional Court strikes down impeachment of PM Han Duck-soo
byline: South Korea’s Constitutional Court ruled on Monday to strike down the impeachment motion against Prime Minister Han Duck-soo and restore his powers, marking the latest twist in the country’s recent political turmoil after his impeachment as acting president more than two months ago.

title: Another suspect arrested over Nagalagam Street shooting
byline: Police have arrested another suspect in connection with the shooting incident that occurred on March 17 in the Nagalagam Street area, in the Grandpass Police Division.

title: Trump looms over Canada’s election as campaign begins
byline: Canada’s newly appointed Prime Minister Mark Carney has called a snap election, sending the country to the polls on 28 April.

title: 57 arrested in raid on ‘Instagram party’ in Pamunugama
byline: Fifty-seven suspects have been arrested during a raid carried out at a hotel in the Uswetakeiyawa area of Pamunugama, following a tip-off that an ‘Instagram party’ was being held involving illegal drugs.

title: Govt to provide fertilizer subsidy for coconut farmers this month
byline: Minister of Plantation and Community Infrastructure, Samantha Vidyarathna, says that the fertilizer subsidy will be provided to coconut plantation owners starting from the end of this month.

title: Sri Lanka-Australia discussions to strengthen political, economic, and maritime ties
byline: The 5th Round of Senior Officials Talks and the third Strategic Maritime Dialogue between Sri Lanka and Australia will take place from March 25 to March 26, 2025, at the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade in Canberra, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs has announced.

title: Be cautious with unknown investments, warns Central Bank Governor
byline: A lack of financial literacy is the primary reason many Sri Lankans fall victim to pyramid schemes, says the Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe.

title: Toddler dies after accidentally consuming diesel in Jaffna
byline: A toddler has tragically passed away after mistakenly consuming diesel from a bottle at home, thinking it was a soft drink, according to Kayts Police in Jaffna.

title: Ex-president Ranil blames current govt for failing to secure Adani investments
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has raised concerns over Sri Lanka’s failure to move forward with large-scale foreign investments, warning that the stalled USD 700 million Adani project alone is a major setback for the country’s economic recovery.

title: Police submit report on election law violations across Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka Police have submitted a detailed report on complaints received by police stations across the island yesterday (23), related to violations of election laws and acts of violence.

title: CBI closes actor Sushant Singh Rajput death case, clears Rhea Chakraborty
byline: Four-and-a half years after it began probing the death of actor Sushant Singh Rajput, the CBI is learned to have closed the case and given a clean chit to actor Rhea Chakraborty, bringing curtains on a case that had gripped the country, reports Rajshekhar Jha. Rajput was found dead at his Bandra flat on June 14, 2020.

title: ‘Not an old plane, no mechanical error’: Minister reveals cause of SLAF aircraft crash
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) training aircraft crash that occurred in the Minuwangate area of Wariyapola, was caused by an error made during pilot training, Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports, and Civil Aviation, Bimal Ratnayake said, citing the SLAF investigation report.

title: US talks with Russia begin in Saudi Arabia eyeing a Black Sea ceasefire
byline: U.S. and Russian officials began talks in Saudi Arabia on Monday aimed at making progress towards a broad ceasefire in Ukraine with Washington eyeing a Black Sea ceasefire deal before securing a wider agreement.

title: Ex-Minister Udaya Gammanpila acquitted in fraud case
byline: The Colombo High Court today (24) acquitted former Minister Udaya Gammanpila and businessman Sydney Jayasinghe of charges related to the alleged criminal misappropriation of Rs. 21 million.

title: Three new envoys to Sri Lanka present credentials to the President
byline: Three newly appointed foreign Ambassadors to Sri Lanka presented credentials to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today (24) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: COPA uncovers luxury vehicle import racket by DMT officials
byline: A scheme involving the importation of luxury vehicles under the guise tractors, orchestrated by officials from the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) using forged documents, has been uncovered during the latest Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) meeting.

title: Ex-Minister Mervyn Silva further remanded
byline: Former Minister Mervyn Silva and two others have been ordered to be remanded further until April 03 after they were produced before Mahara Magistrate’s Court.

title: Ex-CJ Jayantha Jayasuriya to be appointed Sri Lanka’s envoy to UN
byline: The Committee on High Posts has recommended the appointment of former Chief Justice Jayantha Jayasuriya, PC, as Sri Lanka’s Permanent Representative to the United Nations in New York.

title: Over 22,000 companies failed to pay EPF contributions – Dy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Labour Mahinda Jayasinghe disclosed that nearly 22,450 companies have failed to contribute to the Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF).

title: Apple Watch may soon come with built-in camera to power AI features
byline: Apple is reportedly developing an Apple Watch with built-in cameras as part of its broader push to integrate artificial intelligence (AI) more deeply across its hardware, according to Mark Gurman’s latest newsletter published in Bloomberg.
